This one will take small teams (6-8 people) at several major airports. Load one-two handbags full of 'dust bombs' - homemade devices that when dropped/thrown will release a fine dust into the air. At the airport, part of the team goes through security as normal, then sets up at pre-planned locations inside the airport. Then we need a 'ringer' to go through security.  They should have something innocuous but forbidden in their bag so they get pulled over by security.  Their job then is to make a fuss: tie up as many security agents as possible. Once the agents are distracted, the 'carriers' rush the gates, with their bags in hand.  They should spread dust bombs as they run.  (Put a couple in your path: the security gaurds who are chasing will probably pause before running through the dust cloud.) When they are about to get caught, the bags should be relayed to the next member of the group in the airport.  Repeat until you run out of people to pass the bags too.  Extra credit if you manage to get the bags out of the passenger areas...  (Bonus if you can have someone *working* for the airport start running around the baggage area at the same time yelling 'Jihad!'  Even if you can't get them anything to place in the bags.) Do this simultaniously across the country in major hub airports, preferably on a busy travel day.  (Thanksgiving Sunday comes to mind...) The airport will have to be emptied until all passengers are re-screened, the dust is cleaned up, the dust is analysed for composition, and possibly the terrorists checked for contagious mega deseases. The dust of course can be any bioweapon that can be delivered in dust form, but it can also be nothing more than ground flour or powedered sugar.  The former has the advantage of being a real threat (you would require treatment for quite a few people this way), while the latter has the advantage of propaganda: You haven't actually *done* anything, but you'll probably have at least one martyr to talk about. In the meantime (and either way) you've shut down airtraffic across the country and around much of the world for several hours.  Done at the right time, you'll disrupt the holliday shopping season, and be able to crow about the western comercialism. You can probably also point out how the security of the airport was more of a danger than your people, and spread some distrust of that...

Terrorist Movie Plot Contest Entry  There is a existing deadly virus, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE) and a way to spread it (Mosquitoes in particular "Culex pipiens" ). Here is the outline for how they could be used to spread terror and lay waste to the U.S. economy and health using the proscribed "30 terrorists with $500,000". By Monta "glad HE'S not a bad-guy" Elkins
and Kirk "Mosquito Man" Averett  Background. Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE) kills about one third of the people who become infected making it one of the most deadly mosquito-borne diseases in the United States. Approximately half of those who survive will have brain damage according to the Centers for Disease Control. http://www.cdc.gov/ncidod/dvbid/arbor/eeefact.htm The virus lives in host reservoirs- typically game birds. Mosquitoes become infected when biting those game birds. The mosquitoes then infect humans when they are bitten. Humans die. Phase One.  Pheasants seem to be the most susceptible domestically-reared game bird
http://edis.ifas.ufl.edu/PS045
Though many other types of fowl could be used as well. Terrorists would seed likely mosquito breeding grounds with mosquitoes and an infected caged bird. Many potential mosquito breeding grounds exist, from ponds, to old tires, to junk yards. Anything that holds small amounts of water can be used.   Timeframe From egg to breeding adult can be as short as 7 days with warm weather (85-100 F) and a bit of organic material in the water for the larva to use as food (a bit of cattle feed would do it). Symptoms usually appear 4 to 10 days after the bite of an infected mosquito. That gives the 30 terrorists at least 11 days to drive and seed Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE) across the country and perhaps as long as 20 days before the first cases appear. Assuming they can drive and seed 5 locations a day for 10 days thats 1500 mosquito sites. Those mosquitoes will continue to seek out breeding locations and other game birds to infect on their own. (And the terrorists will have other work to do after the 10th day- long before the first symptoms appear in the public- see Phase II). 12 days after the process begins people begin to present to hospitals with some "unidentified viral encephalitis". In 3 more days the trickle becomes a stream and the CDC is called to try to isolate the cause. The deaths are appearing in news reports and the public becomes fearful. In 2 more days the CDC has identified EEE and calls for mass spraying of the insecticide, malathion, nationwide to stop the mosquitoes. Even if enough trucks, and planes could found to kill every mosquito on the planet on this day; tens of thousands of people have already been infected for a week. "Walking wounded." The stream of infected arriving at medical facilities becomes a flood. Since there is NO effective treatment for EE 30% of them will die and 50% of the survivors will ultimately suffer brain damage. Malathion deteriorates rapidly in the environment due to sunshine and water, so spraying must be done daily. Cities, counties and states will "fight" over limited supplies of insecticides and the hundreds of thousands of vehicles and devices needs to administer it. Effect:
Hospitals are overwhelmed. People are afraid to leave their houses to go to work or shopping. Tens of thousands of people are called upon in the mosquito eradication attempts; leaving their regular productive endeavors. A significant portion of the work force either dies or becomes brain damaged, further crippling the economy. The national guard and armed forces are recalled from their duties in Iraq and elsewhere to operate the spraying machinery and fight the plague at home. EEE become endemic in the U.S. from this point on. A state of Emergency is declared by the President severely curtailing American liberties. Border and airline security measure are stepped up severely to make a show of the attempt to keep anyone from smuggling something as small as 1cc of a blood borne pathogen into the U.S.   Phase II
"The extremely small droplet aerosols utilized in adult mosquito control are designed to impact primarily on adult mosquitoes that are on the wing at the time of the application."
http://www.mosquito.org/mosquito-information/virus.aspx   The terrorist stopped early in their seeding of natural, existing, breeding grounds of mosquitoes to develop some special, protected breeding areas. Inside and thus protected from the malathion spraying. The terrorists had each rented 3 (or more) widely separated apartments, in large cities across the U.S. In those apartments they build small plywood "ponds" covering most of the floor, lined with plastic sheeting; warmed with fish tank temperature controllers; seeded with mosquito larvae and food. 2-3 animals would be left in each apartment, with plenty of separate food & water for them. You would want them to live as long as possible. Only one would have to be infected initially-- the others would get infected pretty quickly. Pick "low rent" districts to keep the rent expense down, and maximize the number of apartment breeding grounds. Poorer neighborhoods would be less likely to notice the apartments and slower to search them when the Presidential order for landlords to search all rental properties ultimately comes. A hole in a window screen allows the mosquitoes to travel outside their warm protected home; infect people and other bird at large and seek additional breeding grounds. Mosquitoes travel up to a 14 mile diameter depending on species; essentially covering all of New York, New York, from 3 strategically placed apartments. The effects on the economy, freedom and feeling of security in the U.S. would be incalculable. Additional Options:
A)
Remove Phase I and begin with Phase II breeding in apartments. That would have less "initial shock", but might hide the infection method lounger since there would be no (dead) birds found caged near water sources. Authorities would spend many days waiting for the malathion spraying to take effect (remember it takes 4 to 10 days for symptoms to appear) and when it did not, many more solving the puzzle of rented breeding grounds in apartments.    B)
Before beginning, taint Consumer (Deet containing) anti-insect sprays with a nerve agent. Their procession through the supply chain will be greatly accelerated once the infection vector is discovered. A very small number of deaths from tainted insect sprays or spraying will cause a significant decline in their use when they are most needed; thus allowing more persons to become infected.  C)
Breed mosquitoes that are selected for malathion resistance before beginning.  D)
Careful planning and work would allow most of the terrorists to leave the area before the plot was revealed, leaving them alive become sleepers agents; waiting for the call to begin again.

If you really want to make an impression on the American nation, the way to do it is to sink an aircraft carrier. Better still, sink an aircraft carrier and make a video of the attack for propaganda.
Now on the face of it, knocking out a carrier is difficult, but I think there might be a small chance as follows:  A. Analyse global carrier delpoyments to work out where they regularly pass through shallow waters. Bottlenecks such as the Straights of Gibraltar or the approach channels to any harbours regularly used by carriers might be candidates. The point is to find a relatively shallow stretch of water where a carrier is likely to go, sooner or later. B. Upon confirmation of an approaching carrier, Sink a large quantity of compressed LPG gas cylinders, clad in explosive designed to rupture the gas cylinders, in the expected path of the carrier. What is a "large quantity"? Well I am thinking of (say) 500 47kg propane cylinders giving 23,500kg compressed gas. The gas will expand by a factor of 250 when released (http://www.lpga.co.uk/fr_ab_lp.htm). C. When the carrier is sailing over the sunk gas cylinders detonate the explosives to release the compressed gas. Note that we are not interested in the potential explosive force of the gas when detonated in oxygen - we just want to release as much gas as possible under the ship to force it down in the water. A few notes: 1. Perhaps you don't "get" this. Normal ship buoyancy relies on the weight of displaced water by a ship. If the water under the ship contains enough rising gas, then the ship will sink. The only question is how much gas is required to achieve this result. 2. If the attack is carried out on a ship approaching a harbour, there should be a chance to get the attack on video. 3. As far as I know, no warship has ever been designed to defend against this type of attack. The only possible defence I can see is to keep the ship sealed airtight so that it will float back up after the gas has bubbled up to the surface. 4. LPG has been suggested because it is easily commercially available. There may be other compressed gases, such as normal air, that have better liquid/gas compression ratios and hence are more suitable for this type of attack. 5. Buying enough LPG gas to achieve this aim would be very expensive today. Perhaps a bit of old-fashioned fraud or even theft would be better than purachsing the gas (after all who wil look for it underwater). 6. Reliably blowing up the gas cylinders under (say) several hundred feet of water would be hard. The only chance I see is a command line laid from the sunk gas to a control point. This is definitely a weak point in the attack. Just to clear up any potential misunderstandings, I have no interest in terrorism - just security.

My movie plot has a nice twist to it in that it does have a big impact but without causing many physical casualties. The assault focusses on a multi-vector attack on two primary targets, ammended by some decoys (to divert attention). The primary targets are both the national bank and the stock market.   As decoys, 2 major US banks are selected.  Two teams of 5 people get fake credentials that allow them to penetrate the infrastructure of the decoy targets (the banks).  The real target is their IT infrastructure, so there may be a backdoor to get them in through external IT suppliers or management/backup firms.  We do not need to hit these very hard as the target is to grab attention.  
The infiltration attempts to gain enough access to nock out the bank computers for at least 1 day, a nice bonus is to get their ATM systems down too.  For the primary targets, a lot of preparation and recon is needed.  The objective is to disable or at least permanently cripple them.  
Each target is assigned a team of 10 people, a good proportion of funding is used in providing them with fake backgrounds, IT and financial training and in selecting and hiring black hat hackers and rogue financial consultants and to purchase information.  After the initial recon and armed with technical details about the working of the IT infrastructure, our infiltrants start to penetrate both organisations.  Secondly, a team of our people and hired blackhats start working on a very specific computer virus to attack our targets digitally. Subteams for the primary targets find out information about the physical layout of the computer infrastructure for the targets, including datacenter location and backup centers.  They infiltrate as far as possible to get access to them, or at least get near to them. On the big day, very early in the morning (think 05:00 or 06:00), the decoys get attacked knocking most of the bank infrastructure offline.  This can be by physically blowing up power relays or networking hubs or electronicly or a combination of both.  The objective is to disrupt, not to destroy. In the subsequent (still mild) chaos, a digital attack (our virus) targets the stock market shortly after opening and the national bank.  This will disrupt financial transactions quite quickly.
When the chaos of both previous events is coming into effect, the infiltration teams start their work targetting in parallel the datacenters and their backups of the primary targets.  The idea here is no longer to cause disruptions, but to actually destroy the equipment beyond repair.  They more damage, the better for the attack scenario.  Though this attack causes little physical damage compared to other, more spectacular attacks, it will have a profound effect on a country like the US that is dependent on its corporations and corporations work largely based on the stock market and the financial market.
By striking both at once, trading will at least come to a temporary halt and maybe even permanently.  With all this data lost or at least inaccessible for a long time, a lot of corporations will fail, resulting in a cascading failure on the economy.

A Summer Sunday, early evening.
All around the city 25 pairs of terrorists are completing their
preparations.  Each pair has a large, stolen four-wheel drive car internally
fitted with home made armour.  Into the car they have packed a large number
of grenades, guns and ammo and a large suicide charge with a timer which
will eventually cause an explosion should it not be triggered by a
terrorist.  The terrorists perform a final check, put on their army surplus
body protection and helmets.  They are ready.        Same day, one hour later.
The terrorists have moved to their initial positions and are listening to
the radio.  They are calm and do not talk.  Each has said goodbye to their
family and friends in letters and videos that will be delivered on Monday
morning.  The music on the radio ends and the news starts.  It is time to
go. Their routes are all similar, starting at the edge of the city they will
each travel through populated areas and converge on the central target.  If
any pair survives the journey, which is only three miles or so, they attack
the final objective.  There is no intention that any of them should survive
the next 15 minutes.          Five minutes later.
Each vehicle is positioned at the start its route.  Guns are checked. Seat
belts are tightened. Helmets are put on.  It's quiet, not much traffic.  The
sun is setting. People are walking, enjoying the pleasant evening.  Outside
coffee shops there are tables and chairs full of chatting customers.  There
are queues at the movie houses. There is no hurry, driving at 30 miles an
hour it will take less than 10 minutes to reach the target.       The first minute of the attack was the most deadly, nobody was aware what
was happening as the world exploded around them.  A couple of grenades fired
into a coffee shop kills or wounds fifty people and sets fire to the
building.  Automatic gun fire directed at a movie queue kills at least a
hundred people in 10 seconds.  Around the city 10,000 people are killed or
wounded before the first panic phone call is received by the police.      A minute later.
Two of the terrorist cars are stopped by head on collisions with other cars
driven by brave, but now dead, drivers.  Through the steam from the radiators
the terrorists make their stand.  When all their grenades and ammo is gone
they explode the suicide charge.  One of the explosions brings down an old
building blocking the road; by bad luck it isolates one of the largest ER
hospitals in the city.        A minute later.
Another pair of terrorists is dead, a grenade misfire killed the pair and
the car crashed into shop front.  In 15 minutes it will explode, destroying
the building and killing a large number of people crowding round to see what
they could see.     A minute later.
The police are now activated in force, but it's a Sunday and there are just
not many immediately available.  There are frantic efforts to get a general
warning broadcast on the local radio but nobody at the radio station is
answering the phone -- the system is now automated and run over cables from
a town 120 miles away and nobody can find the phone number.  An old beat cop
finally remembers the air attack warning system from the 1950s and shoots
off the rusted locks from the box containing the switch.  A mornfull wail
starts throughout the city, but will anybody understand its meaning?         A minute later.
Human targets are now few and far between.  Most people have moved off the
main streets but there is a lot of mostly ineffective small arms fire from
buildings. Lucky shots take out the tires of five terrorist vehicles which
slows them down a little.  The stream of reports to the police is now
massive, overwhelming, but a pattern is emerging which allows a plot to be
made on the city map and so the final objective is now obvious.       A minute later.
The lack of human targets allows the terrorists to speed up and they are
almost in sight of their target.  But by now the police are putting the
major ground attack defence plan into action.  Remotely controlled road
blocks are activated and many of them operate as planned, raising bollards
from the road surface to stop traffic.  Police and military stationed within
the central part of the city have reached their emergency stations and have
set up RPG launchers in killing areas around the final objective.  As each
of the terrorist cars reaches a set of bollards, a second set are raised
behind them, trapping them and they are killed with RPGs. Unfortunately
some of the terrorists set off their suicide bombs and some are triggered by
the RPGs.  Some explode a few minutes later when the timers trigger them.            A minute later.
All the terrorists are dead.  Total casualties approach 15,000. Large parts
of the city are alight.  The hospitals are overwhelmed.   Ten minutes later.
Six of the remaining terrorist cars explode destroying or damaging many
building.   Last Scene. The old beat cop is standing in a road.  As the camera pans around from his
face we see what he sees.  Collapsed buildings, fires, emergency vehicles as
far as the eye can see.   If possible the old beat cop should be played by Sean Connery.

Now some ways to "persuade" them into joining are many, such as money, a new start, or threatening loved ones. They're terrorist, they'll find a way. Plot:  The group of terrorists are out to disrupt us *economically*. After the trucks are flipped over, the perpetrators simply walk away, ostensibly to a waiting lead car. (The sidekick and comic-relief can be inserted here, assuming the hero was introduced in the traffic tie-up as a local law enforcement officer.) The next half hour is built in plot development.  The perpetrators working on their next caper.  To damage one or several *oil refineries* in the U.S. at the same time. A few gratuitious scenes of potential riots at the pump should be added.  (Food riots due to failed out-of-fuel truck delivery systems too.) Depending on the Director, more gratuitous scenes of mass-violence, perhaps a lynching at the refinery of a captured perpetrator, cross-beams (maybe prevented just in the nick of time by our hero or sidekick, with a feel-good speech of the usual "we can't become like them" theme. Terrorists infilitrate a Pakistani Airliner headed for the United States via Europe.  The passengers themselves are harmless -- except for one man.  He is clearly of Middle-Eastern/Pakistani appearance, but is dressed as a business man; much older and more distinguished than the prototypical terrorist. Amongst his "Western business man" possessions is a cellular phone, not unlike the other passengers aboard this airplane.  But this phone, unlike the others, is linked to a low-yield nuclear bomb hidden away in the plane's cargo hold... The bomb itself was "smuggled" aboard by al-Queda operatives under the aegis of Pakistan's ISI intelligence force.  Months prior to this operation, the ISI had trained and supported select al-Queda jihadists to work as airline luggage employees.  After successful training, the ISI helped to plant the men at the airport flying out of Islamabad.  These men played their parts as luggage handlers with impeccable skill. The nuclear weapon was also provided to the operatives by the ISI, in disassembled parts.  The parts were re-assembled under the supervision of Pakistani nuclear weapons scientists.  Once completed, the bomb was "disguised" -- its outer shell was removed and it was buried within several lead-encased boxes.  These boxes were then painted/covered over with a wood grain finish.  Some of these boxes were actually packed with clothes, personal items, etc. -- anything needed to add to the legitimacy of the cargo.  Finally, the "hot item" was loaded into the airliner; it avoided x-ray detection through the efforts of the inside men working within the airport. When the plane reaches Europe, the lone operative aboard (the business man), makes a seemingly innocuous phone call.  But the dismal reality is this phone call arms the bomb through a frequency in the business man's cell phone.  The modified phone sends a signal directly to a receiving mechanism on the bomb itself. That receiving mechanism is a barometer-based gauge.  Once the plane descends into US airspace, the barometer is triggered and engages the short-fuse timer.  Moments thereafter, the bomb explodes as the plane makes its final descent. Because the plane's altitude is still relatively high and its course steady, the US rapid-response air defenses fail to see the threat coming.  No F-16s are sent to intercept, and no air-traffic control warnings are issued to the plane. The plane's in-bound status from Europe also aids the terrorists; if the plane were on a direct Pakistan-to-US flight, then a greater level of scrutiny would have been placed upon it by the United States. Finally, because the plane's altitude is still relatively high, the resulting nuclear detonation is far more devastating because the bomb has enough height to clear any potential buildings that might othewise mitigate its blast, however nominal that may be.

Roddy at April 2, 2006 05:11 PM proposes pumping air into a gas pipeline to create an explosive mixture, and then igniting it. I think it would be hard to do much damage that way. First, you can't just pump air into the pipeline. You'll set off pressure alarms and blow safety valves. To go undetected for more than a few  minutes (seconds?) you'd have to remove an equal amount of gas. You could do that, but now the plumbing is more complicated. At a 10-to-1 air to gas ratio, there's not much gas left. You could do better by pumping in O2; then you only need a 2-to-1 ratio. But now you need tanks of O2, and the scale of the attack is limited by the number of tanks you can amass. I don't know about trans-continental pipelines, but the gas pipes that run under city streets are at 50 PSI, which is just over 3 atmospheres, and the pressure is downregulated to a few PSI at the gas meter before it enters a building. So there isn't that much gas in the pipes, and that limits the size of the bang. You don't get to choose the time of detonation. The gas will detonate as soon as any of it reaches a lit burner or pilot light, and that will probably happen before you've pumped very much O2 into the system. The detonation will probably propagate back through the system, although it might stop at the meter, the pressure regulator, or the thermocouple cutoff. In any case, it would be hazardous to your health to be attending the O2 injection equipment when this happens. The original post talked about a 2.5 ton (of TNT) explosion, but I think that is optimistic. And whatever explosion you do get is going to be distributed through great lengths of pipe. Most of that length is underground, so not many people will be hurt. If it ruptures pipes, safety systems will cut off the flow immediately. Even if it doesn't, the gas company is going to know that something is seriously wrong. My guess is that the best you can do with an attack like this is
- start a few fires
- cause a few injuries
- wreck some gas meters and appliances
- rupture some gas mains (as backhoe operators have always done)     One additional cost going forward might be the need to inspect equipment and appliances for damange before they can be put back into service. There could be a lot more potentially damanged equipment than actually damage equipment, and the only way to find out is to have a licensed technician go on-site to see. That could multiply the ultimate cost of the attack. Even so, I don't think this is a 9-11 class attack. It is more nusicance-level.

Plot: the US has a network of satellites designed to provide an early warning of a nuclear attack. Those satellites, known as Defense Support Program (DSP) satellites, can detect the infrared energy radiated from the hot exhaust of a missile's rocket engine launched from anywhere on the earth's surface. In 1979, the system indicated a massive Soviet nuclear strike. The entire continental air defense interceptor force was put on alert, and at least 10 fighters took off. Furthermore, the National Emergency Airborne Command Post, the president's "doomsday plane," was also launched, but without the president on board. It was later determined that a realistic training tape had been inadvertently inserted into the computer running the nation's early-warning programs. See http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/nova/missileers/falsealarms.html In this plot, terrorists construct infrared "bombs" made from thermite http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermite with the aim of creating false nuclear launch alarms in the DSP system. They make a large number of these bombs and deploy them throughout Russia in proximity (as close as possible) to actual nuclear launch silos, whereupon they are set off simultaneously, simulating a massive launch of nuclear missiles. This in turn provokes an actual nuclear exchange between the US and Russia.

9/11 Part Deux - It seems most of the ideas work on creating a "big bang", for lack of a better term.  I see the opportunity for a heavy character development theme.  While a few of the pieces have been mentioned before, I haven't seen them all drawn together. Recreate basic events of 9/11 - a small group trains for a specialized task to carry out four coordinated attacks.  The bad guys boast of the recreating the successes of 9/11 using the same model. The groups trains for and infiltrates the merchant marine (nationality is unimportant).  Points of attack are the Malacca Straits (as described in Dangerous Waters by John Burnett); the Louisiana Offshore Oil Port (LOOP)/Port Fourchon; the Panama Canal; and the Suez Canal. It's only necessary to land one or two entry level crew members per ship over the period of a year.  Just as with 9/11, wait for the right environment (all the ships in the right spots at the same time), then execute.  The goal is to severely damage the targets.  One ship would need to be an oil tanker making a port of call at LOOP.  Big explosions aren't required for purposes of the plot.  Realize that a one-degree heading error, by the time it is discovered, will be too late to correct before a collision occurs.  No massive takeovers are required.  While not required for the plot, to make the idea more saleable to Hollywood, the Panama/Suez Canal attacks could spectacularly destroy a ship in the locks. By knocking out a major US oil port and disrupting international shipping lanes, gasoline goes to $10-$15 per gallon in the US, the economy grinds to a halt, there are mass layoffs and mass shortages not just of oil but of food (no more lettuce from 3,000 miles away for Caesar Salads), and no more Nike's from Indonesia. Leading up to the attacks we learn about the characters.  We hear various reports about the trade deficit, the hardship of high oil prices, and political posturing by impotent leaders.  Our heroes are every day people, some with children, getting by as best they can.  After the attacks, the shortages occur against a backdrop of incivility, gang violence, and vigilantism such that America rips itself apart.  Some of our heroes don’t make through the first weeks.  Those that do face apparently insurmountable obstacles Oh, and like 9/11, one of the attacks fails.  The Israelis thwart the Suez Canal plan.

Acts of physical terror of unimaginable scale is hopefully beyond reach of a described group (10-20 unskilled people, $500000). Killing a limited amount ex. thousands of people by bombing or otherwise would be terrible, but would not cause any significant shift, no matter which social category they'd belong to. Take the explosion in Russian Checnen school in Beslan. Several hundred children (basically the entire school) died in a blast after being kept hostages for few days in September 2004. Did it change anything ? Not a single thing. Sure, in situations like this the government takes the chance to pass the laws it needs and there is a lot of talk, but otherwise nothing changes. Likewise, wiping the entire country population by poisoning the water supplies or something like that is out because such contaguious viruses or dangerous chemicals are either not capable enough, not cheap enough or will strike them back. Besides, it's not the point, terror is not about killing, it's about letting live in fear. And so the best alternative is likely to be indirect manipulation from behind the curtains. An investment into racism and hate, which is already tense enough throughout the world, will return tenfold. For example, publishing a single cartoon has caused hundreds of people to voluntarily damage the associated country's assets. Was there a bit of such manipulation in this case ? No way to tell for sure but it's highly likely. Then again, in which way such an unskilled group can affect the way the majority of the population perceives the situation ? Propaganda, normal for the government and huge corporations is out. Therefore what's left is probably an indirect instigation, by highly focused attacks on people of very specific groups. A group of 10 could enjoy a huge amplification in effect as soon as the affected group will strike back the wrong target. It wouldn't necessarily be a riot, but even a slow burning on the inside would impact the society. It's difficult to say which group should be targeted and it certainly depends on the country or even local situation, for example in Germany in 1920s it appeared beneficial to target jews. I'm sure special government squads were secretly raiding both sides at that time to ensure both don't return to normal. Therefore, a group with such a limited capabilities could have found a spot in which a high tension in society already presents and try to feed the fire until the tension is unbearable. The goal would then  not be to cause a riot or anything in particular, it'd be a slowly pushing people in the right direction. It'd take a lot of very careful thought, a lot of time and the outcome is not predictable at all, but this is exactly the point - the dinosaurs were not killed by the stone falling from the sky, but by the slow climate changes that came after. And it also appears that right now people are not ready to resist such an attack. Living in a world of lies, propaganda and advertisement, they would rather fight very specific particular threats rather than subtle changes in the wind. More likely not only they wouldn't notice it until it's too late, but they would try not to notice.

The terrorists are split into 5 groups of 4 each.  A mother, a father, and two children.  Each group travels around the country dumping a variety of bio-contaminants into local water supplies.  The contaminants are contained in swim floats: rafts that are weighted enough to settle at the bottom of reservoir where they will be almost impossible to discover.  The fuse is a substance put into the air filler tube of each raft.  The substance dissolves at the rate of about an eighth of an inch per day.  The rafts are set to go off from two to three weeks after they have been deployed.  Over a week's time each group hits 30 water supplies. The bio-contaminants were obtained from a mothballed military facility where security had been out-sourced to a foreign company.  In general, the security and accounting at the facility have gotten so bad due to budget cuts that the stolen items would not be missed for years, if at all. If the terrorists are stopped they look like a family going to the beach that mistook the reservoir for a public lake. After all of the reservoirs are infected.  Each group loads up their mini-vans with 60 gallons of gasoline.  This is done through the regular filler cap which has been re-routed to a gas hot water heater sitting in the trunk area of the mini-van.  The fuse is put together from pieces of various fireworks that were legally purchased in states like Indiana.  The terrorists are careful to take no more that 15 gallons from each gas station that they visit and to use cash so that no credit card alerts are raised. Their targets are Boys Town, The Mayo Clinic, a Catholic Cathedral, a large Christian fundamentalist church, and a synagogue.  These are bonuses.  The real reason for the bombings are to insure that the terrorists cannot be captured and coerced into revealing which reservoirs have been poisoned.

Of the several terrorist attacks since and including 11 Sep, 2001, the Sep 11 attacks probably had the largest world wide impact. The train bombing in Spain and the tube bombing in London both produced limited results, largely because those were local modes of travel. The Sep 11 hijackings are more an international nature, and it also struck at the world's sole superpower. There is something inherently more horrific about an air-crash, viz Lockerbie. Symbolism as well as number of victims both play a part in target selection. So, once more, to strike terror into the world, the terrorists will go back to planes, and their concept of operation will be the simultaneous in-air explosions of multiple US carriers. Terrorists in groups of 2 or 3 will board flights originating in the US, and with destinations domestically and internationally. The explosives, detonators and fuzes will be carried internally in the same manner that drug mules smuggle their cargo. A ceramic or obsidian blade will also be smuggled aboard. At the designated time in flight, two terrorists will have to go to the lav together; if they have a third accomplice, he can act as a shield or distraction to prevent other passengers from seeing the other two enter the same lav. In the lav, one of the terrorists will kill the mule; then using the smuggled ceramic blade, must now disembowel the other terrorist in order to retrieve the explosives. Because one can swallow only so much cargo, the explosives will have to be military grade HE, like RDX or PETN. In the bathroom, the bomb is assembled; the terrorist exits the lav, and uses the same ceramic blade to relock the lav from the outside to prevent other people from accidentally discovering the disemboweled terrorist. The bomb will then have to be detonated somewhere vulnerable, probably over the wing box, or in the tail-section. A sufficiently determined suicide terrorist cannot be stopped. With this action, they have once again showed that they are willing to martyr themselves for their cause, and not even the increased security of the world's greatest superpower can detect and prevent intentional downings of commercial aircraft, and that there is no where safe for anyone. X-raying shoes are not the answer.

I hope this makes it in, it's kind of at the wire, but it's been a busy month and I was out of town this weekend. It has elements of several other people's, but I came up with it before looking through the list, so hopefully I'll get originality for tying them all together and being more coherent than some . . . -- It's 4:15 PM, and Joe Castle was sitting in the DHS Command bunker in downtown Washington DC. The bunker was put in place two years ago, the budget items covered with black marker or simply not existing in some places in the Congressional record. Despite the millions on hardening against NBC threats, super-redundant communication links, and the underground monorail that connected them out to the tunnels that ran between the various congressional buildings and the Library of congress, he still couldn't get a decent cup of coffee. He thought about ducking out to go to the coffee shop in Union Station, but he didn't think it was worth the 20 minute trip out, and then the 35 minute trip back in (each checkpoint he pass would a good 3-5 minutes to his trip). Perhaps in the next procedural review he could get an exception for Drinks On Demand, allowing them courier priveleges and putting them on the pre-approved list so he could get a good cup of Java while it was still hot . . . who would question a line item add for a "DOD Courier . . .?" He gazed across the monitors, a chaotic babble of information from dozens of different feeds -- closed circuit of most of the major downtown intersections, the George Washington Univerisity campus cameras, CNN, MSNBC, and several of the local news stations. Other monitors were quieter, but the still poured information to those who watched. . . the latest dumps from AT&T and other ISP's, courtesy of the NSA, a variety of early warning sensors from around the net and SCADA systems across the country, with large "protected by Cisco" banners flashing on important looking flatscreens when he happened to walk past them and they would look good in a shot. As he sighed and walked across to the pathetic government instant coffee stand in the corner, his view halted on on monitor that was showing the early early early evening not quite afternoon news on the local Fox channel. He stopped not because of the headlines, the same old same old, more dead in Iraq, more bad things happening locally in society, but because of the moment of recognition when he saw the perfect teeth and purposely blank expression of Tricia Tattler, and felt a pang of regret. He hadn't seen Tricia in two weeks, since they had finally parted ways -- the tension between his having to keep his work secret and her burning desire for a juicy lead had finally pushed them apart. But he still couldn't help but think of how things could have been in a happier time, so he stopped and watched until the end of the segment. "That's all Jim. And now, we'll go to Bob in our traffic center, for traffic on the eights. Bob, how's the rush hour shaping up?" "Well Tricia, if it's not one thing, it's another. We have a back up forming on the American Legion Bridge on the outer loop heading in to Virginia due to a disabled truck, which apparently couldn't make it all the way across, so we're down a lane with no shoulder, and of course the folks headed back to Maryland are rubbernecking and slowing the flow going the other way. We're getting reports of another truck broken down on the Wilson bridge as well, more details as we get them. I guess it's just not a good day for the rental companies. I bet a lot of commuters wish those folks had picked a different day to move. As always, we'll have another update every 10 minutes until 7 PM, but now to the weather." Joe looked at the grainy traffic camera view before the camera popped over to the Hank, the Washington Weather Wizard. He thought sure he could see several other trucks bearing rental company markings on the other side of the Wilson bridge in the rubbernecking . . . did one of them have it's flashers on? He dropped thoughts of coffee from his mind, and quick-walked over to his console, and began pulling up images from the traffic feeds. While he typed away and clicked with his mouse, he flipped his desk audio through some of the feeds until he got the one he wanted running in the background . . . "Ten Ten WINS, the most listend to radio station in the country, serving all of New York City, with traffic and weather every ten minutes on the tens. It's a shaping up to be one heck of a rush hour today . . . someone's going to get a ticket, but that's not much comfort -- it appears that not one but TWO drivers have chosen to ignore rush hour tunnel restrictions, and now we are looking at gridlock in the Lincoln AND Holland tunnels. I'd hate to be them when the police finally make it there, but that's not going to help anyone get home faster. The damage has already been done. And, it appears that if you are trying to head out the other side of the city, you're out of luck there too there's a snarl developing on the Brooklyn Bridge, a minor accident between several cars and a mid-sized container truck have brought things to a standstill, and there is major backup on the BQE heading towards Staten Island, due to a disabled vehicle on the lower span -- we haven't been able to get a good look in there, so cell callers, if you are stuck that neighborhood, give us a ring and let us know what's going on. Up at the George Washington Bridge, again on the lower span, there is some type of impasse, details as we get them. But really folks, this might be a good time to hit that happy hour and try again in a few hours. At least the subway's running fine . . ." Joe had pulled up the NYMTA feeds on the bridges in question, and looked at similar scenes to those in DC . . . Penske here, Ryder there, Uhaul for one or two, but in each case, he was looking at different flavors of rental container trucks sitting parked or wrecked on major bottlenecks . . . all bridges. He began to feel the pit of his stomach drop down to where his toes were, if he could feel them through the growing cold that was enveloping his body. He scrambled for the speeddials on his phone -- the damn things hadn't been programmed properly yet, and he managed after a few rings to get "Welcome to Audix. To set up your voice mailbox, please press pound." He clicked to a new line, and dialed his buddy Rick up in NYC from memory. The phone rang as he pulled up Baltimore, and then Boston. The phone clicked. "Rick --" "Hi, this is Rick MaJeure of the DHS, NYC field office. I'm not at my desk right now, but if you would like to leave a message . . . The attacks began midmorning on the Friday after Thanksgiving. Thirty minutes after a large regional mall in rural South Carolina opened for its traditional after-Thanksgiving sale, a bomb exploded in the center atrium. Placed at the bottom of a trash receptacle, the bomb consisted of nothing more than a timer, a blasting cap, and dynamite, covered with 30 pounds of ball bearings. The explosion shattered most of the plate-glass display windows and sent shrapnel flying in all directions. Over 400 people were killed instantly and well over a thousand—there were too many for a precise count—were wounded. A television crew sent to interview shoppers about the sale was standing just inside the west entrance and was broadcasting live to the local morning talk show when the bomb detonated. The blast tore off most of the reporter’s right arm and decapitated the woman she was interviewing, as the inevitable slow-motion replays later demonstrated. The camera crew, shielded from the blast by a concrete pillar, escaped serious injury and continued to broadcast unedited pictures of the slaughter. An alert staffer at the television station notified the network, and less than five minutes after the explosion, the national audience was viewing live pictures of bloodied shoppers stumbling and crawling toward the exits. The local emergency plan, designed to cover floods and hurricanes, never anticipated having to treat so many seriously injured people at the same time. Doctors and paramedics who rushed to the scene were overwhelmed by the scale of the carnage. The nearest hospital was more than 20 minutes away, no available transportation could move hundreds of wounded at a time, and the hospital had only 30 beds and no trauma center. Consequently, the medical teams treated the wounded in the parking lot, inadequately equipped with supplies scavenged from the Wal-Mart across the street and nearby drug stores. By noon, the television cameras could no longer avoid showing the growing pile of severed arms and legs as doctors gave up all hope of reconstructing the shattered limbs of the victims. Even with industrial-scale amputations, the medical teams could not possibly deal with all of the injured, and more than half of them died before they could be treated. Their bodies were stacked in the far corner of the parking lot and incinerated with borrowed gasoline as darkness fell. Within an hour of the South Carolina explosion, a dozen similar attacks on regional malls and shopping centers were confirmed as viewers watched footage arriving from such disparate places as western Massachusetts, upstate New York, central Pennsylvania, tidewater Virginia, and northern Alabama. It appeared at first that the large cities had been spared, since new reports from the Midwest were coming from rural Ohio, southern Indiana, central Iowa, and northeastern Missouri. Then a news flash from Chicago announced that the first floor of the city’s largest downtown department store had been hit by at least three explosions that caused a partial collapse of the second and third floors. Estimates of the number of dead and wounded were not immediately available. As new bombs popped up on colorful television maps, the western movement of the attacks became obvious. By the time the President addressed the nation from the White House at noon and called for calm, shopping centers throughout the country were ghost towns. Most of the employees of the stores fled with the customers, leaving their supervisors wondering how to recoup the losses of what should have been the biggest sales day of the year. Rural police and fire departments were uncomfortably aware all of the attacks except the Chicago bombing were taking place in jurisdictions like theirs, and they searched for bombs as best they could. But they had no experience in finding or disarming explosives, despite having accepted billions of dollars in grants from the Department of Homeland Security for training their personnel to respond to terrorist attacks. Only in central Nebraska did a sheriff’s deputy manage to find and disarm one of the devices before it detonated, and she admitted that discovering it was pure dumb luck. With the malls evacuated, the 10 attacks west of the Mississippi River caused mainly property damage. They produced only 31 deaths—23 employees of the stores and malls, 3 police officers, and 5 firefighters. By sunset on Friday, 27 malls had been bombed. Except for the Chicago department store, all the attacks struck regional malls in rural areas. Nearly 10,000 people were dead; no one knew how many were wounded. The number of deaths kept increasing as emergency care facilities were overwhelmed and unable to treat all the wounded. One reporter tried to put the losses in perspective by observing that over the next year, more Americans would be killed by drunk drivers than were killed in the mall bombings. The media’s attention was diverted briefly from its round-the-clock coverage of the attacks as commentators and pundits excoriated the hapless reporter. Within two hours his network pulled him from their lineup. By Saturday, television stations had preempted all programs and were running nothing but news without commercial breaks. However, with nothing new happening, the air time was filled with updates on the overloaded medical facilities near the bombing sites, endless videos of the dead and dying, and commentary by pundits who turned out to know little about terrorism. The pressing need to fill broadcast time led to some bizarre episodes. The Commerce Secretary urged Americans to return to their local malls and spend as much as they could to make up for the business losses of Friday. One commentator suggested a nuclear attack on France. Religious leaders who had gleefully argued that the 9/11 attacks on New York and Washington were evidence of divine retribution for urban wickedness eagerly appeared for interviews but proved reluctant when asked to explain why terror had come to the heartland. On Sunday, a new wave of bombings struck gas stations across the country between midnight and dawn. In all, 287 stations were hit, all located in middle-class and upper-income bedroom communities. Many of the fires caused by the explosions spread to nearby residential areas, destroying thousands of homes and killing 95 firefighters and over 2,500 others. The gas station bombings cut the usually heavy traffic of Thanksgiving Sunday by more than two-thirds. Many people refused to travel, imagining that they might be blown up as they fueled their cars. More than 30% of the American workforce failed to report for work on Monday morning, though no one was sure how much of that was directly linked to people who did not return home on Sunday. Investigations showed how easy it was to attack the gas stations. All 287 stations were closed on Saturday evening. The terrorists simply drove up, dropped their bombs in the trash cans next to the pumps, and drove off without alarming anyone or even attracting attention. A single terrorist could easily have delivered 10 or 15 bombs in a 40-mile radius in just a few hours. On Monday morning, stores began opening for the first time since Friday. Most shoppers stayed away from malls and downtown shopping areas, and there were no lines at gas stations. By contrast, grocery stores were jammed with customers who apparently felt safe in their local markets. Shortly after noon Eastern Standard Time, sixty-one bombs exploded in supermarkets in the 20 largest American cities. Two bombs that failed to explode were discovered late Monday in Denver, each a simple dynamite bomb buried deep in the frozen food section sealed in a plastic bag that had contained Brussels sprouts. Fewer people died on Monday morning than were killed in the Friday mall attacks, Even so, almost 1,200 people were killed and more injured, many of whom were trampled as shoppers stampeded out of the markets. The immediate effect of the attacks was that Americans were afraid to leave home, and they shunned retail businesses. People were wary of going anywhere that had crowds or that might be a target of a bomb. Gas stations reported most people pumped only a few gallons of gas into their cars before speeding away. (Highway statistics showed that the number of traffic accidents, which had been decreasing for years, rose sharply after the Thanksgiving attacks. Statisticians attributed most of the increase to nervous drivers eager to escape from harm's way.) Retail businesses started to fail and unemployment rose quickly. For weeks, no one claimed credit for the attacks. The government was unable to discover who the attackers were, or whether they were foreign or domestic. And then, on December 21, the terrorists released a communiqué revealing that the bombings were carried out by 28 individuals spending less than $500,000. The communiqué never specified the reasons for the attacks; its tedious and ambiguous political diatribe led conspiracy theorists to blame everyone imaginable: the Israelis, the British Queen, the Catholic Church, the Environmental Liberation Front, Sufi mystics, the Dalai Lama, even the Paraguayans. Of greater interest was the terrorists’ description of exactly how they carried out the attacks with so little money and so few people. They recruited disaffected members from their communities based on two criteria: ability to learn another language, and a physical appearance that Americans would be likely to mistake for Hispanic. (Later intelligence revealed that about a third of the terrorists were light-skinned and went to tanning salons or used tanning products to darken their skin tones to resemble more closely the American stereotype of the working-class Hispanic.) Before the terrorists entered the United States, they attended language schools in Mexico and Guatemala and learned enough Spanish to pass as Mexicans or Central Americans. Once they were in the United States, it was easy to obtain fake IDs and green cards in the larger metropolitan areas. Cleaning services in malls were only too happy to hire apparent Hispanics willing to work at the minimum wage and without benefits or complaints. (This statement led intelligence officials to theorize that the attackers had placed their bombs in supermarkets on Monday morning while posing as shoppers.) Looking like Hispanic janitors, the terrorists drew no attention in the malls and had no problem planting their bombs, which had been easily assembled from readily-available materials with very little technical training. The communiqué boasted that the attack team had learned how to assemble and arm the dynamite bombs in a single weekend. It is unclear whether the terrorists intended to use their communiqué to hammer a socioeconomic wedge into America, but that was certainly its effect. Many non-Hispanic Americans announced their suspicions of all Hispanics, whether illegal or not, even though nobody could describe who was a Hispanic and who wasn’t, or how to recognize one. Race riots became commonplace as gangs of vigilantes punished those they suspected as possible terrorists. With law and order breaking down and the economy heading south, the President considered imposing martial law, but the Middle Eastern wars had decimated the National Guard, and the U.S. Army was spread too thin by its overseas commitments to offer much help. One insurance company after another announced that its policies did not cover terrorist attacks. There would be no insurance money for rebuilding the malls or for replacing the homes burned in the fires. For those killed who were lucky enough to have life insurance, two-thirds of the policies did not cover death by terrorism. On a cold morning in February, the President attended a ceremony at the site of the South Carolina mall to honor the dead and wounded. The mall had stood empty since the day after Thanksgiving. None of the insurance companies would pay for the damage from the attack because of the terrorism exclusion in their policies; none of the owners or tenants had enough money for repairs; no investor wanted to take on the task of cleansing the blood that had stained the walls and floors; and no government funds were available to restore the mall. When he agreed to speak, the President hoped his words would give inspiration and hope and comfort. But political and economic realities forced him to devote most of his speech to defending his policies on rapidly rising unemployment and the skyrocketing cost of imports—especially oil—that accompanied the collapse of the dollar on international money markets. It was hard to decide which was more melancholy: his words, or the ruined shopping mall 200 yards in back of him. Following the President’s speech, and after a long and very Protestant prayer by a local minister, the President’s wife stepped up to the podium and touched two thick cables to an automobile battery. Within seconds, carefully-placed explosive charges reduced the mall to a mound of rubble.

An adversary gains access to the audio equipment and locates the microphone which will be used by the contestant who wins, to sing a closing song.  The microphone is disassembled.  A small chamber containing a highly poisonous, odorless, tasteless, and colorless gas is fitted inside, with a mechanism for release.  The mechanism must first be activated, remotely, through the use of a cell phone, and triggered by the contestant's voice, upon singing into the microphone.  The "trigger-man," which may or may not be the same adversary who planted the device, may be in the audience, or within cell phone range.  After being triggered, the gas is inhaled by the contestant; to achieve greater societal impact, the gas must act quickly as to cause the contestant to collapse while viewers are watching.  It may be plausible to extend this attack to other significant scenarios, such as a presidential address; it may be even more plausible to realize an attack from this angle when the significant individual is speaking in a location where access to the audio equipment is less restricted (i.e., a high school or university, versus a government building).

Since the recent Cryptogram said I can ignore the April 30 deadline, here is my contribution to the string of terrorist plots.  It encapsulates pieces of many previous ideas, but the (new?) idea is to leverage one terrorist attack off the other. Divide your strike group of 30 terrorists:  one group of 20 and a second group, UNKNOWN to the first, of 10.  Group A, which thinks it is THE terrorist group, is split into small cells (3-4).  Each cell is tasked with attacking government officials in small and midsized towns:  city council meetings, mayors, town managers, public works directors, etc.  Accomplishing this would require only publically available data and easily available weapons.  In my town, for instance, if there is any security for a town council meeting, it consists of one off-duty police officer.  It would be very easy to scout the location, show up at the meeting, kill and wound dozens, and then leave.  If the targets were widely scattered, it would be impossible to predict where they would strike. The power of these attacks is three-fold.  First, these are very soft targets.  It will be easy to pull off a number of attacks before security is tightened.   And even if security is tightened, a simple variation in types of attacks (e.g. shifting from attacks on public meetings to attacks in private homes) will keep the new security from being effective. Second, it has a very high panic factor because it strikes at the "heartland."  After the anthrax attacks in DC, there were panicked reports of anthrax all over the place, including many in small towns.  Should attacks actually occur in small towns, this panic factor would be multiplied many times. The third feature of these attacks is that they are a deliberate distraction.  These attacks would generate a LOT of media attention, and would put pressure on the government to respond.  A temporary but large shift in security forces would occur; literally, the government would be looking the other way when the "real" attack occurs. Group B, which is not known to Group A and is operationally separate, is tasked with planning an attack against a single, high profile ECONOMIC target, say the NYSE or the Chicago Mercantile Exchange.  These targets are currently guarded, and a spate of attacks would cause some heightened security.  However, since all the group A attacks are against public sector targets in small and medium towns, there would be a tendency to expect the pattern to continue.  Thus, police in Chicago could well be pulled off the Mercantile Exchange and shifted to City Hall. The Group B attack, if successful, would have major reprecussions.  First, it would have a significant economic impact.  The closure of the Mercantile Exchange for even a few days would have a powerful negative impact on all the world markets.  Second,  the terror factor would be multiplied because we would be blind-sided.  Having been conditioned to expect public-sector attacks (or even having experienced relief when one or more cells from Group A is caught), a new attack in a different sector would be that much more powerful:  no one would know where to expect the next attack, and so people would be blindly preparing for every possible attack.

I know the terrorist plot contest  has ended but it took too long for me to hatch the idea... I would still like to throw it out to because I think it merits some exposure. Sometime in June, 1976 I was having as beer in  the Poplar Place (a watering hole in Moab, Utah) when a table full of "hippies" started fantasizing about celebrating the the 200th anniversary of the American revolution with another one... Most of them were thinking in terms of blowing up the Glen Canyon Dam (a hot topic about that time, Edward Abbey's 'The Monkey Wrench Gang' had just hit the GreenPeace best sellers list" Then, a well oiled guy at the bar swung around and, claiming to be a power systems engineer, said, "That wouldn't do much to most of the country. If you want to sock it to the USA, you need to do the following: There's public document published by the Commerce Department called 'The Atlas of The United States' that is in most public libraries. Get a copy of and go to the map of the electrical power grid. It shows the rough location of the transport lines of country's power distribution system weighted by capacity. Do a little math and you'll see that over 1/3 of the nation's power crosses the western continental divide at ~17 points. If you really want to mess things up economically for America - build some mortars that can lob a good sized piece of chain over a highline, practice up on how to aim them, build them with a fairly accurate timer that can run for a week or so and set them off within 30 seconds of each other, backpack them into the bushes up on the divide, pick a time sometime in the middle of the summer (say, July 4th) for them to do their thing, and, BOOM! out go te lights, except with a twist. There is a HUGE amount of power stored in the electromagnetic fields surrounding transport power lines when they are operating at high capacity and when the current flow suddenly halts, the fields collapse and it's all injected back into the grid. Whithout something to stop it, it's injected back into the generators at the power plants. ... it would effectively convert the generators into motors that were trying to turn against the rotation of their power sources...) There are elaborate switching systems in place to protect the whole system from these effects but they are designed to cope with a certain probability of event. If you sever the lines that carry 1/3 of the nation's power in the same 30-second interval the event will fall WAY outside the designed capability of the protection systems and a significant fraction of the nation's power generating machinery would be destroyed. You will have destroyed much of the critical resource that would be required to manufacture the replacements needed to recover from the event itself. That would REALLY screw things up!"

The Continental Phased Array The scene is Washington, DC. Unbeknownst to the general public, as a component of the domestic war on terror, the government’s Department of Homeland Security has mandated a significant improvement in the ability to locate cellular phones. The intent is to be able to accurately locate any operating cell phone instantly. The telecommunications industry has responded positively, as in the recent past. The capability to locate a handset, initially introduced to support 911 emergency services, has been enhanced with embedded GPS receivers. Cell phones are now able to determine and transmit their locations to the cellular system upon receipt of a specially coded request and without the user’s knowledge. Because the DHS does not understand GPS, no one in the government realizes how accurate theses locations can be. The scene is a terrorist Improvised Explosive Device R&D facility in the desert northwest of Baghdad. While studying ways to use cell phones as remote control detonators, terrorists have discovered the potential of the handset location capability. Employing Russian mathematicians, scientists and hackers, they develop new differential algorithms that can allow a cell phone to determine its location to a fraction of a cellular carrier wavelength and report, among other things, motion and orientation. Combined with a viral delivery system, all cell phones can now be infected with new programming that can silently turn on the carrier wave with good phase control. The ability to form a phased array beam is in place. The final demonstration of the R&D project shows the microwave-oven-like effect of a grid of cell phones mounted on a wall, when beamed at a suitable target. The scene is Baghdad. It is the first field trial of the new terrorist radio weapon. The terrorists run a computer program that infects the cellular system, and then all of the handsets in the city. The program turns on all of the transmitters forming a beam that downs a Blackhawk helicopter. The software removes itself immediately afterward. The source and nature of the attack cannot be determined because each cell phone individually is considered harmless, even though many people suspect they can cause brain damage in the user. They terrorists realize that the cellular carrier wave frequencies reside in the Water Hole, a range of frequencies at which the Earths atmosphere is transparent to electromagnetic transmissions. The terrorists infect cellular systems throughout the world. The resulting beamforming capability can put 1,000,000,000 watts of electromagnetic energy on any target at sufficiently large distance. Using the North American and Indian phased arrays, they disable satellites in orbit around the Earth. Using city-sized arrays they damage aircraft, some of which crash due to control issues. Recall that we couldn’t use cell phones on airplanes until recently. This is an enormous disruption to the Western economies, with relatively minor effects in the less developed parts of the world. It takes a long time to figure out how this is happening. Special Sci-Fi alternate ending: The terrorists realize that a properly oriented subarray can transmit a polarized beam. With careful timing, good weather and the unwitting help of the astrophysical community, they point the beam at the sun, affecting the plasma dynamics and triggering solar flares. The timing is arranged to have the resulting solar storms hit the Earth when it is 12:00 noon in St. Louis, Missouri. The ensuing damage to the power transmission grid is devastating. Alternate alternate: Fortunately, heroic counterhackers discover the software infections and disrupt the beamforming signals and no beam results. Armed with knowledge of the nature of the exploit, the government is able to prevent its repetition. Another Alternate Alternate: The terrorists send a beam to every nearby star. 300 years later the aliens arrive, expecting the original senders to make good on their promises.

This threat works on the premise that one pound of gasoline properly vaporised has the explosive power of roughly 1 pound of TNT. The attack uses a fully loaded gasoline tanker driven through a road tunnel under a city. The objective is to collapse the tunnel and bring down overhead buildings. Prior to the drive through a team disables the tunnel extractor fans to prevent dilution of the fuel air mix.
The team driving the tanker fit a high capacity pump with a spray head for efficient dispersal / evaporation. To lower the risk of premature ignition another team blocks the entrance(s) to the tunnel after the tanker enters. After an appropriate delay the tanker drives at a measured speed through the tunnel spraying the gasoline to achieve the best fuel/air mix. At the same time the tanker team drop multiple timer based igniter units set to flare at exactly the same time. To get more explosive power in a smaller space a second tanker containing LOX can drive through at the same time spraying liquid oxygen.  After completion of the run something like 80-100 tons of fuel and oxidiser is ready to explode in a few hundred yards of tunnel. The effect depends on the depth of the tunnel. If possible the tunnel is selected to be very shallow and located under vulnerable buildings. The effects of the attack are multiple 1. Tunnel is damaged / destroyed.
2. Overhead buildings are damaged / collapsed.
3. Some in-tunnel fatalities - not the primary objective.
4. Massive disruption to fuel distribution system afterwards - e.g. no tankers allowed in road tunnels.    Variations on this theme can include using disused railway tunnels and sewers.

EMP has been mentioned several times, but I think this is new: Given that airplane-travel since 9/11 has been given so much scrutinity and "safety enhancements", a blow targeting commercial airtraffic would be highly effective psychologically, i.e. demoralizing. An EMP "bomb" is rather easy to build: several high-voltage capacitors, a battery and high-voltage power supply to keep them fully charged, some wiring, the coil and a timed trigger, amounting to a few kilos. Note that none of the components are on any aircraft security "do-not-bring" list. Also, no chemical substances are used that might be sniffed by bomb-squad dogs. The scenario goes: build a lot of these devices and sneak them aboard on a lot of airplanes nationwide at the same time. Have them go off at roughly the same time and watch those planes fall from the sky or at least experience severe technical troubles. For maximum effect plan the distribution and triggers so that several aircraft approaching the same airport at the same time are affected, thus maximizing the trouble on the ground. Imagine the tower having to watch several planes go down because all runways are full. And by distributing these incidents over a period of maybe one hour, media coverage and thus panic reactions can be maximized. And you don't even need suicide terrorists for it, AFAIK it is still possible to check in your suitcase and not go on board on inner-american flights. Such a suitcase will not be detected by explosive-sniffing dogs. X-ray might pose a problem, but it should be possible to camouflage the X-ray pictures. This is probably the weakest point. Alternatively, shipping electronic components via airfreight shouldn't arouse suspicion (no explosives!), so bringing down FedEx and UPS planes shouldn't be a problem. Note that EMP "bombs" probably won't bring down the airplanes at once. Airplanes have to withstand lightning bolts that carry much more zest, so the main components are hardened. This is even benefical threat-wise. There is a good chance that the airplane cannot continue its normal flight route and will declare emergency, requesting immediate landing. Given the timing, several airplanes will report emergencies at the same time in the same place, overloading the emergency-handling capabilities in towers, control centers and airports.

I have a very simple scenario in mind that is partially covered by about five or six others, but I see it as a particularly interesting one so I'd like to offer my take on it. It targets a specific type of institution that seems to be universally (in the US at least) held as untouchable for moral reasons - the church. By "the church" I mean mainly the variants of christianity that I believe are most common - although let's not rule out moslem churches either... Anyway, the church is something most people have an important relation with and it seems a large part of the US population frequently go to church. That means that there are regularly a large congregation of civilians in one spot and thus should be a nice terrorist target. Now assume the terrorists travel around in teams and randomly attack church buildings in different ways, defined by what would work for each particular church building: * Using (home-made) explosives to blow up the church during mass * Sniper attacks on people milling about outside after mass * Block doors and windows and set fire to wood/cloth if there's a lot of combustible material (do you have churches built out of wood?) * Block doors and windows and let in carbondioxide (from a couple of stolen trucks perhaps?) or other poisonous gas. Obviously the terrorists act as much as non-terrorists as they can to avoid suspicion, staying in place for quite a while (random lengths of time) before and after the actual attacks. Churches have traditionally been the place where you can always find haven. The result of the attacks will be that people feel insecure in the place where they should feel most secure and any security measures, ludicrous or not, will likely be accepted by the general public; * Church-goers must register with their "home church" * Visits to other churches must be approved in advance * Airport-like screening measures will be introduced * Church money will go to improved surveillance of both church interiors and the perimeter (because it will be required by federal law) instead of helping those in need * Confession will no longer be secret, law will mandate that the priest records confessions if required by law enforcement agencies Imagine the fear that would rise if this continues unstopped, a church full of people killed about once a month for several months - years! Oh, and to make it easier to point fingers in the wrong direction the terrorists might decide to blow up any type of church except, say, jewish churches. Wouldn't that give the nazi sympathizers a boost to their ranks if they were savvy enough to use the opportunity for propaganda? And unsavvy enough to not realize they were being used as decoys... By the way, the attacks would probably cause panic even if they only happened two or three times and the individual terrorist cells were caught immediately anyway. Oh yeah, the movie script based on this would of course include some really high-tech federal investigators using systems that can track every american everywhere, and finally that system  would be able to statistically figure out who these people are and where they are now so there can be a really tense last half hour of chasing dirty terrorists and "disarming" churches while mass is going on... Cheers!
